Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Father Lorenzo Alto, St. Emeric Church, 185 Ave D, New York, NY. 

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Mendez.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Father Lorenzo Alto, St. Emeric Church, 185 Avenue D, New York, N.Y.

Council Member Mendez moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Messages & Papers from the Mayor
Communications from City, County & Borough Offices

Communication from the Democratic Organization of Queens County - Submitting for the Advice & Consent of the Council, the name of Jose M. Araujo, for appointment as the Queens County Democratic Commissioner of Elections, pursuant to Section 3 - 204 of the Election Law.
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: Jose M. Araujo, Queens County Democratic Commissioner of Elections

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Katz
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council, Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter and Section 62-722(a) of the Zoning Resolution, the Council hereby resolves that the actions of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Applications no. C 080221 MMQ, an amendment to the City Map, and C 080385 HDQ, a disposition, shall be subject to Council review. These applications are related to applications no. C 080381 ZMQ, N 080382 ZRQ, N 080383 HGQ and C 080384 HUQ that are subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, Willets Point Development Plan, Queens (C080221MMQ)

Items.Title:
By Speaker Quinn
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Applications no. C 070261 ZSM, a special permit pursuant to Sections 13-562 and 74-52 of the Zoning Resolution in the Borough of Manhattan, Council District no. 3 to allow an attended public parking garage with a maximum capacity of 137 spaces at 133-145 West 22nd Street (Block 798, Lots 19, 21, 23, 24 and 25), shall be subject to Council review.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, G West 22nd Street Realty, LLC, Manhattan (C070261ZSM)

Items.Title:
By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Katz
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d (b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application nos. C 080364 PQQ, C 080276 MMQ and C 080362 ZMQ and shall be subject to Council review.  These items are related Uniform Land Use Procedure Application no. N 080363 ZRQ.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Hunters Point South, Queens (C080276MMQ)

Resolution approving the decision of the City Planning Commission on ULURP No. C 060333 ZSM (L.U. Items.Title:
Introduction & Reading of Bills
See Attached
Discussion of Resolutions
Resolutons
General Discussion
Extension of Remarks
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

Resolution calling upon the State legislature to adopt legislation amending the State Municipal Home Rule Law (MHRL) to give the City the authority to provide in its Charter that any change in the City’s term limits law must be subject to voter referendum.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Any change in the City’s term limits law must be subject to voter referendum.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass Assembly Bill A7299-B and Senate Bill S3195-C, which would prohibit the writing, sending, or reading of text messages on a hand-held mobile telephone or mobile wireless device while driving.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Prohibit the writing, sending, or reading of text messages on a hand-held mobile telephone or mobile wireless device while driving.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to easily identifiable licenses for vendors.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Easily identifiable licenses for vendors.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the Department of Homeless Services to maintain an intake center in Manhattan.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Requiring the Department of Homeless Services to maintain an intake center in Manhattan.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to modify the Adam Walsh law, Public Law 109-248, so that it requires background checks for prospective legal guardians or custodians of children.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Modify the Adam Walsh law, Public Law 109-248, so that it requires background checks for prospective legal guardians or custodians of children.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to term limits for elected officials.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Term limits for elected officials.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Human Resources Administration to change its rules to allow Public Administrators to act as organizational friends.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Veterans
Items.MatterName: Human Resources Administration to change its rules to allow Public Administrators to act as organizational friends.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to vending in Sunset Park, Brooklyn.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Vending in Sunset Park, Brooklyn.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating a small business lease program for establishing an environment for fair negotiations in the commercial lease renewal process in order to determine reasonable lease terms.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Small Business
Items.MatterName: Creating a small business lease program for establishing an environment for fair negotiations in the commercial lease renewal process in order to determine reasonable lease terms.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to regionally significant projects and empire zones.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Economic Development
Items.MatterName: Regionally significant projects and empire zones.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating civil penalties for damaging memorials honoring firefighters, police officers, or armed services members.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Creating civil penalties for damaging memorials honoring firefighters, police officers, or armed services members.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting the use of mobile handsets to text message while driving.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting the use of mobile handsets to text message while driving.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York City Charter in relation to providing that any changes to term limits for elected officers must be submitted for the approval of the electors.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Providing that any changes to term limits for elected officers must be submitted for the approval of the electors.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to recovery of expenses for repair work performed by or on behalf of the department of housing preservation and development and department of finance statements of account.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Recovery of expenses for repair work performed by or on behalf of the department of housing preservation and development and department of finance statements of account.
